First, we need to gather some information about both Taco Bell and Roy Rogers. According to Statista, Taco Bell had 4.82 billion customer transactions in 2019. On the other hand, Nation's Restaurant News reported that Roy Rogers had approximately 43 million customers in 2018.

Since we're interested in comparing the number of customers each restaurant serves in a year, we need to make sure we're looking at the same time period for both. We'll assume that Roy Rogers had a similar number of customers in 2019 as it did in 2018.

Taco Bell = 4.82 billion
Roy Rogers = 43 million x 365 = 15.695 billion

Now we can see that Roy Rogers serves more customers per year than Taco Bell. Therefore, the answer is (B) no.

This suggests that Taco Bell is more popular and likely to have more customers than Roy Rogers.
